raw.name: NVDA
raw.defaultConfigurationInstructionsHTML: Configure NVDA with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.

instructions: If NVDA made the focus mode sound, press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>Space</kbd> again to turn browse mode back on.
If NVDA made the browse mode sound, press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>Space</kbd> again to turn focus mode back on.

setupScript.scriptDescription: opens the 'Add Delivery Address' modal dialog, and sets focus on the 'Add' button
setupScript.name: openAddDeliveryAddressDialogAndFocusAddButton

instructions.instructions: Starting at the 'Add' button inside the dialog, activate it to open the nested 'Address Added' dialog.

browseMode: Configure NVDA with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.
If NVDA made the focus mode sound, press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>Space</kbd> again to turn browse mode back on.
focusMode: Configure NVDA with default settings. For help, read <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria-at/wiki/Configuring-Screen-Readers-for-Testing">Configuring Screen Readers for Testing</a>.
If NVDA made the browse mode sound, press <kbd>Insert</kbd>+<kbd>Space</kbd> again to turn focus mode back on.

assertions.assertionStatement: Dialog description is conveyed as: 'The address you provided has been added to your list of delivery addresses. It is ready for immediate use. If you wish to remove it, you can do so from your profile.
assertions.assertionPhrase: convey dialog description as: 'The address you provided has been added to your list of delivery addresses. It is ready for immediate use. If you wish to remove it, you can do so from your profile.

assertions.assertionStatement: Role of the focused element ('button') is conveyed
assertions.assertionPhrase: convey role of the focused element ('button')

assertions.assertionStatement: Name of the focused element ('OK') is conveyed
assertions.assertionPhrase: convey name of the focused element ('OK')
